intro: Neckia ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf neckia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
